name: Eiffel Tower
short_description: Iconic iron tower with hourly light shows after dark and stunning city views.
more_notes: Light show runs every hour on the hour at night — best viewed from Trocadéro plaza across the river. Book elevator tickets 60 days in advance. The stairs are an option for older kids but may be tough for younger children or older adults.
address_or_search_text: Eiffel Tower, Champ de Mars, Paris
google_maps_query: Eiffel Tower, Av. Gustave Eiffel, 75007 Paris

name: Sacré-Cœur Basilica
short_description: Hilltop basilica with sweeping panoramic views of Paris and a lively artists' square.
more_notes: Lots of stairs but there's a funicular that saves the climb — great for older adults and kids. Carousel nearby at the base. The view from the top of the steps is one of the best in Paris. Free entry to the basilica.
address_or_search_text: Sacré-Cœur, 35 Rue du Chevalier de la Barre, Paris
source_notes: Spreadsheet (funicular + carousel note) + recommendation list (stairs + view note)
google_maps_query: Basilique du Sacré-Cœur, 35 Rue du Chevalier de la Barre, 75018 Paris

name: Musée d'Orsay
short_description: World-class Impressionist art in a breathtaking converted railway station.
more_notes: Closed Mondays. Recommended over the Louvre for a more manageable and rewarding museum visit — the building itself is gorgeous. Great collection of Monet, Renoir, Degas, and Van Gogh.
address_or_search_text: Musée d'Orsay, 1 Rue de la Légion d'Honneur, Paris
source_notes: Spreadsheet (closed Mondays) + recommendation list (preferred over Louvre)
google_maps_query: Musée d'Orsay, Esplanade Valéry Giscard d'Estaing, 75007 Paris

name: Sainte-Chapelle
short_description: Breathtaking 13th-century chapel with some of the finest stained glass in the world.
more_notes: The upper chapel's floor-to-ceiling stained glass windows are jaw-dropping, especially on a sunny day. Small enough to visit in under an hour. Can be combined with a walk around Île de la Cité.
google_maps_query: Sainte-Chapelle, 10 Bd du Palais, 75001 Paris

name: Notre-Dame de Paris
short_description: Newly reopened Gothic cathedral on Île de la Cité — a must-see after the restoration.
more_notes: Reopened in December 2024 after the 2019 fire. The restored interior is stunning. Free entry but expect lines. Check current visiting hours and any reservation requirements.
address_or_search_text: Notre-Dame de Paris, 6 Parvis Notre-Dame, Paris
google_maps_query: Notre-Dame Cathedral, 6 Parvis Notre-Dame, 75004 Paris

name: Tuileries Garden & Louvre Plaza
short_description: Beautiful formal gardens and the iconic Louvre courtyard — perfect for a relaxed stroll.
more_notes: Great for wandering without going inside the Louvre. The Tuileries has fountains, green chairs for resting, and a playground. The glass pyramid at the Louvre courtyard is a great photo spot. Connects nicely to a walk along the Seine.
source_notes: Spreadsheet (outside note) + recommendation list (Louvre plaza wandering)
google_maps_query: Jardin des Tuileries, 75001 Paris

name: Jardin du Luxembourg
short_description: Elegant park with toy sailboats, a carousel, puppet shows, and prime picnic spots.
more_notes: Kids can rent toy sailboats to push around the central fountain with sticks. There's a lovely carousel and sometimes puppet shows. Great spot for a picnic or just sitting in the famous green metal chairs.
google_maps_query: Jardin du Luxembourg, 75006 Paris

name: Jardin d'Acclimatation
short_description: Charming amusement park and gardens in the Bois de Boulogne — a full kids' day out.
more_notes: Rides, gardens, a small zoo, playgrounds, and boat rides. Ideal for a half-day or full day with children. Located in western Paris in the Bois de Boulogne. Requires a separate entrance fee; ride passes available.
google_maps_query: Jardin d'Acclimatation, Bois de Boulogne, 75116 Paris

name: Galeries Lafayette Haussmann
short_description: Grand department store with a stunning Art Nouveau glass dome and a free rooftop terrace.
more_notes: The interior glass dome is an architectural marvel — worth visiting even if you don't shop. The free rooftop terrace has excellent views of the Opéra Garnier and across Paris. Cafés inside for a rest stop.
address_or_search_text: Galeries Lafayette Haussmann, 40 Boulevard Haussmann, Paris
source_notes: Recommendation list (department store, glass domes, cafés)
google_maps_query: Galeries Lafayette Haussmann, 40 Bd Haussmann, 75009 Paris

name: Galeries Lafayette Rooftop
short_description: Free panoramic rooftop with café service and sweeping views over the Paris rooftops.
more_notes: Take the escalators all the way up inside Galeries Lafayette. The terrace is free and open to all — no purchase required. Great for a drink or snack while enjoying the view. Less crowded than the Eiffel Tower.
google_maps_query: Galeries Lafayette Rooftop, 40 Bd Haussmann, 75009 Paris

name: Le Bon Marché Rive Gauche
short_description: Paris's oldest department store — elegant, less crowded, with beautiful architecture.
more_notes: A more refined and less touristy alternative to Galeries Lafayette. Beautiful Art Deco interior. Connected to La Grande Épicerie, one of the best food halls in Paris.
address_or_search_text: Le Bon Marché, 24 Rue de Sèvres, Paris
google_maps_query: Le Bon Marché, 24 Rue de Sèvres, 75007 Paris

name: Champs-Élysées & Arc de Triomphe
short_description: Paris's grand boulevard — walk from the Arc de Triomphe downhill toward the river.
more_notes: Start at the Arc de Triomphe for the view, then stroll downhill through shops, cafés, and tree-lined sidewalks toward the Tuileries. The walk is mostly flat and downhill in this direction, easier for all ages.
address_or_search_text: Arc de Triomphe, Place Charles de Gaulle, Paris
google_maps_query: Arc de Triomphe, Place Charles de Gaulle, 75008 Paris

name: Latin Quarter & Saint-Germain-des-Prés
normalized_name: latin quarter saint germain des pres
short_description: Charming left-bank neighborhood full of bookshops, cafés, and winding cobblestone streets.
more_notes: Perfect for wandering and people-watching. Pop into small shops, grab a drink at a sidewalk café. Boulevard Saint-Germain is the main artery. Café Mabillon is a recommended stop along the way.
google_maps_query: Boulevard Saint-Germain, 75006 Paris

name: Café Mabillon
short_description: Classic Parisian sidewalk café on Boulevard Saint-Germain — great for people-watching.
more_notes: Specifically recommended as a solid café find in the Saint-Germain area. Good for a drink break while wandering the Latin Quarter.
google_maps_query: Le Mabillon, 164 Bd Saint-Germain, 75006 Paris

name: Le Marais
short_description: Trendy historic district with boutique shops, galleries, and some of Paris's best food.
more_notes: One of the best neighborhoods for wandering. Great mix of fashion boutiques, vintage shops, art galleries, and excellent food. Place des Vosges is the heart of the area and great for kids to run around.
google_maps_query: Le Marais, 75004 Paris

name: Merci
short_description: Beloved Parisian concept store and café — fashion, homewares, and a cozy used-book café.
more_notes: A personal favorite — a must-stop every trip to Paris. Three café spaces inside including a charming used-book café in the basement. Great for gifts, fashion, and homewares. Located in Le Marais.
source_notes: Recommendation list (favorite store/café, visits every trip)
google_maps_query: Merci, 111 Bd Beaumarchais, 75003 Paris

name: Fleux
short_description: Fun multi-store design shop for home goods, gifts, and food — several locations on one block.
more_notes: Multiple storefronts on the same block in Le Marais, each with a different focus (home, food, gifts). Great for unique souvenirs. Easy to combine with Merci since they're in the same neighborhood.
address_or_search_text: Fleux, 39 Rue Sainte-Croix de la Bretonnerie, Paris
google_maps_query: Fleux, 39 Rue Sainte-Croix de la Bretonnerie, 75004 Paris

name: Rue Crémieux
short_description: Instagram-famous street with colorful pastel houses — a quick, charming photo stop.
more_notes: A short pedestrian street near Gare de Lyon with brightly painted houses. It's a quick visit — just walk through, take photos, and move on. Best in daylight. Please be respectful of residents.
google_maps_query: Rue Crémieux, 75012 Paris

name: Walking Along the Seine
short_description: Stroll the riverbanks past bridges, bookstalls, and landmarks — the quintessential Paris walk.
more_notes: The paths along the Seine are flat and accessible, great for all ages. Pass bouquinistes (old booksellers), bridges, and views of Notre-Dame and the Eiffel Tower. The stretch between Musée d'Orsay and Notre-Dame is especially scenic.
google_maps_query: Quai de la Tournelle, 75005 Paris

name: La Grande Épicerie de Paris
short_description: Paris's ultimate gourmet food hall — artisan cheeses, pastries, chocolate, and more.
more_notes: Connected to Le Bon Marché. You can buy amazing French butter here and they'll vacuum-seal it for you to bring home. Incredible selection of cheeses, wines, chocolates, and prepared foods. Great for edible souvenirs.
address_or_search_text: La Grande Épicerie de Paris, 38 Rue de Sèvres, Paris
google_maps_query: La Grande Épicerie de Paris, 38 Rue de Sèvres, 75007 Paris

name: L'Avant Comptoir du Marché
short_description: Standing-room tapas-style bar with creative French small plates — a fun, casual experience.
more_notes: No reservations, just walk up to the counter and order from the hanging menu cards. Small plates and natural wines. Fun atmosphere but very small — may be tricky with younger kids.
google_maps_query: L'Avant Comptoir du Marché, 14 Rue Lobineau, 75006 Paris

name: Ladurée — Champs-Élysées
short_description: The legendary macaron house — gorgeous pastries in an ornate Parisian salon.
more_notes: Famous for their macarons and elegant tea salon. The Champs-Élysées location is the most iconic. Can be pricey but worth it for the experience. Kids usually love picking out colorful macarons.
google_maps_query: Ladurée, 75 Av. des Champs-Élysées, 75008 Paris

name: Ladurée — Rue Royale
short_description: The legendary macaron house — gorgeous pastries in an ornate Parisian salon.
more_notes: Famous for their macarons and elegant tea salon. The Champs-Élysées location is the most iconic. Can be pricey but worth it for the experience. Kids usually love picking out colorful macarons.
google_maps_query: Ladurée, 16 Rue Royale, 75008 Paris

name: Ladurée — Bonaparte (St-Germain)
short_description: The legendary macaron house — gorgeous pastries in an ornate Parisian salon.
more_notes: Famous for their macarons and elegant tea salon. The Champs-Élysées location is the most iconic. Can be pricey but worth it for the experience. Kids usually love picking out colorful macarons.
google_maps_query: Ladurée Bonaparte, 21 Rue Bonaparte, 75006 Paris

name: Ostra Paris
short_description: Excellent oyster bar and seafood restaurant — highly recommended from a recent visit.
more_notes: Went here last trip and it was really good. Fresh oysters and seafood in a nice setting. May want to make a reservation.
address_or_search_text: Ostra Paris, Rue de Bretagne, Paris
google_maps_query: Ostra, 17 Rue du Petit Pont, 75005 Paris

name: The French Bastards — Marais (Rambuteau)
short_description: Trendy modern bakery with creative pastries and excellent croissants — multiple locations.
more_notes: Several locations around Paris so you'll likely pass one. Known for inventive twists on classic French pastries.
google_maps_query: The French Bastards, 23 Rue Rambuteau, 75004 Paris

name: The French Bastards — Marais (Temple)
short_description: Trendy modern bakery with creative pastries and excellent croissants — multiple locations.
more_notes: Several locations around Paris so you'll likely pass one. Known for inventive twists on classic French pastries.
google_maps_query: The French Bastards, 5 Rue du Temple, 75004 Paris

name: The French Bastards — Oberkampf
short_description: Trendy modern bakery with creative pastries and excellent croissants — multiple locations.
more_notes: Several locations around Paris so you'll likely pass one. Known for inventive twists on classic French pastries.
google_maps_query: The French Bastards, 61 Rue Oberkampf, 75011 Paris

name: The French Bastards — Rue St Denis
short_description: Trendy modern bakery with creative pastries and excellent croissants — multiple locations.
more_notes: Several locations around Paris so you'll likely pass one. Known for inventive twists on classic French pastries.
google_maps_query: The French Bastards, 181 Rue St Denis, 75002 Paris

name: The French Bastards — Sèvres
short_description: Trendy modern bakery with creative pastries and excellent croissants — multiple locations.
more_notes: Several locations around Paris so you'll likely pass one. Known for inventive twists on classic French pastries.
google_maps_query: The French Bastards, 60 Rue de Sèvres, 75007 Paris

name: Carette — Place des Vosges
short_description: Elegant Parisian pâtisserie-salon famous for its rich, decadent hot chocolate.
more_notes: Known especially for their hot chocolate — one of the best in Paris. The Place des Vosges location has a beautiful terrace. Also serves classic French pastries and light meals.
google_maps_query: Carette, 25 Place des Vosges, 75003 Paris

name: Carette — Trocadéro
short_description: Elegant Parisian pâtisserie-salon famous for its rich, decadent hot chocolate.
more_notes: Known especially for their hot chocolate — one of the best in Paris. The Place des Vosges location has a beautiful terrace. Also serves classic French pastries and light meals.
google_maps_query: Carette, 4 Place du Trocadéro, 75016 Paris

name: L'Éclair de Génie — Rue Montmartre (Café)
short_description: Artisan éclair shop with gorgeous, inventive flavors — almost too pretty to eat.
more_notes: Beautifully crafted éclairs in flavors like yuzu, salted caramel, and seasonal specials. Small shop, quick visit. Great for a dessert stop while exploring Le Marais.
address_or_search_text: L'Éclair de Génie, 14 Rue Pavée, Paris
google_maps_query: L'Éclair de Génie Café, 122 Rue Montmartre, 75002 Paris

name: L'Éclair de Génie — Galeries Lafayette
short_description: Artisan éclair shop with gorgeous, inventive flavors — almost too pretty to eat.
more_notes: Beautifully crafted éclairs in flavors like yuzu, salted caramel, and seasonal specials. Small shop, quick visit. Great for a dessert stop while exploring Le Marais.
address_or_search_text: L'Éclair de Génie, 14 Rue Pavée, Paris
google_maps_query: L'Éclair de Génie, Galeries Lafayette, 35 Bd Haussmann, 75009 Paris

name: L'Éclair de Génie — La Fabrique
short_description: Artisan éclair shop with gorgeous, inventive flavors — almost too pretty to eat.
more_notes: Beautifully crafted éclairs in flavors like yuzu, salted caramel, and seasonal specials. Small shop, quick visit. Great for a dessert stop while exploring Le Marais.
address_or_search_text: L'Éclair de Génie, 14 Rue Pavée, Paris
google_maps_query: L'Éclair de Génie La Fabrique, 32 Rue Notre Dame des Victoires, 75002 Paris

name: Mamiche
short_description: Outstanding neighborhood bakery — the jambon comté sandwich and almond croissant are musts.
more_notes: Specifically recommended for the jambon comté sandwich and the almond croissant. A favorite among locals. Get there before the best items sell out.
source_notes: Recommendation list (jambon comté sandwich, almond croissant)
google_maps_query: Mamiche, 45 Rue Condorcet, 75009 Paris

name: Breizh Café Montorgueil
short_description: Superb Breton crêperie — try the hazelnut and brûléed banana crêpe.
more_notes: Excellent savory buckwheat galettes and sweet crêpes. The hazelnut and brûléed banana crêpe is specifically recommended. Kid-friendly — most children love crêpes. Located on lively Rue Montorgueil.
google_maps_query: Breizh Café, 14 Rue des Petits Carreaux, 75002 Paris

name: MONBLEU Faubourg Montmartre
short_description: Artisan pâtisserie known for creative Mont Blanc desserts and beautiful pastries.
more_notes: Specializes in Mont Blanc variations and other refined French pastries. A good stop on the way to or from Grands Boulevards area.
address_or_search_text: MONBLEU, Rue du Faubourg Montmartre, Paris
google_maps_query: MONBLEU, 37 Rue du Faubourg Montmartre, 75009 Paris

name: Printemps Rooftop Terrace
short_description: Gorgeous free rooftop atop the Printemps department store with 360° Paris views.
more_notes: Another excellent free rooftop option near Galeries Lafayette. Less well-known than some tourist viewpoints, so often less crowded. The café on the terrace serves drinks and light bites.
address_or_search_text: Printemps Haussmann Rooftop, 64 Boulevard Haussmann, Paris
google_maps_query: Printemps Rooftop Terrace, 64 Bd Haussmann, 75009 Paris

name: Café de la Paix
short_description: Historic grand café facing the Opéra Garnier — a Parisian institution since 1862.
more_notes: Beautiful Belle Époque interior. Perfect for a coffee or pastry while admiring the Opéra Garnier across the square. Pricey but you're paying for the setting and history.
address_or_search_text: Café de la Paix, 5 Place de l'Opéra, Paris
google_maps_query: Café de la Paix, 5 Place de l'Opéra, 75009 Paris

name: Les Deux Magots
short_description: Legendary literary café in Saint-Germain — known for their excellent croque monsieur.
more_notes: Once the haunt of Hemingway, Sartre, and Simone de Beauvoir. The croque monsieur is specifically recommended. A quintessential Parisian café experience. Touristy but worth it for the atmosphere.
address_or_search_text: Les Deux Magots, 6 Place Saint-Germain des Prés, Paris
google_maps_query: Les Deux Magots, 6 Place Saint-Germain des Prés, 75006 Paris

name: L'Entrecôte
short_description: No-menu steak frites restaurant — just walnut salad and perfectly sauced steak.
more_notes: Famous for serving only one thing: a walnut salad followed by steak frites with their secret herb butter sauce. The recommender had the most amazing steak frites at the Bordeaux location and says the Paris location is also excellent. No reservations — just queue up.
google_maps_query: Relais de l'Entrecôte, 15 Rue Marbeuf, 75008 Paris

name: Odette Paris
short_description: Charming choux pastry shop near Notre-Dame with adorable cream puffs in many flavors.
more_notes: Known for their beautiful choux à la crème (cream puffs). The shop has a lovely upstairs seating area with views toward Notre-Dame. Great for a sweet treat after visiting the cathedral.
google_maps_query: Odette, 77 Rue Galande, 75005 Paris

name: Hôtel National des Arts et Métiers Rooftop
normalized_name: hotel national arts et metiers rooftop
short_description: Stylish boutique hotel rooftop bar with a relaxed vibe and lovely Paris skyline views.
more_notes: A cute rooftop bar that's less touristy than the department store rooftops. Good cocktails and a nice atmosphere. Check if there's an age minimum for the rooftop bar if bringing children.
address_or_search_text: Hôtel National des Arts et Métiers, 243 Rue Saint-Martin, Paris
google_maps_query: Hôtel National des Arts et Métiers, 243 Rue Saint-Martin, 75003 Paris

name: Angelina
short_description: Iconic Parisian tea salon famous for the richest, most indulgent hot chocolate in the city.
more_notes: The "L'Africain" hot chocolate is legendary — thick, rich, and served with whipped cream. The Mont Blanc pastry is their signature dessert. The Rivoli location near the Tuileries is the original. Expect a queue.
google_maps_query: Angelina, 226 Rue de Rivoli, 75001 Paris

name: Bouillon Chartier — Grands Boulevards
short_description: Historic 1896 workers' restaurant with stunning Belle Époque décor and very affordable prices.
more_notes: No reservations — just show up and queue (it moves fast). Classic French comfort food at incredibly low prices in a gorgeous dining room. Kids welcome. A truly unique Paris dining experience.
address_or_search_text: Bouillon Chartier, 7 Rue du Faubourg Montmartre, Paris
google_maps_query: Bouillon Chartier, 7 Rue du Faubourg Montmartre, 75009 Paris

name: Bouillon Chartier — Montparnasse
short_description: Historic 1896 workers' restaurant with stunning Belle Époque décor and very affordable prices.
more_notes: No reservations — just show up and queue (it moves fast). Classic French comfort food at incredibly low prices in a gorgeous dining room. Kids welcome. A truly unique Paris dining experience.
address_or_search_text: Bouillon Chartier, 7 Rue du Faubourg Montmartre, Paris
google_maps_query: Bouillon Chartier Montparnasse, 59 Bd du Montparnasse, 75006 Paris

name: Bouillon Chartier — Gare de l'Est
short_description: Historic 1896 workers' restaurant with stunning Belle Époque décor and very affordable prices.
more_notes: No reservations — just show up and queue (it moves fast). Classic French comfort food at incredibly low prices in a gorgeous dining room. Kids welcome. A truly unique Paris dining experience.
address_or_search_text: Bouillon Chartier, 7 Rue du Faubourg Montmartre, Paris
google_maps_query: Bouillon Chartier, 5 Rue du 8 Mai 1945, 75010 Paris

name: Francette
short_description: Floating restaurant barge near the Eiffel Tower — a memorable dining experience on the Seine.
more_notes: Book at least one month in advance. The barge is near the Eiffel Tower with river views. Could be a great birthday dinner option (Cindy's birthday?). Check Level 1 seating availability.
source_notes: Spreadsheet (barge near Eiffel Tower, book one month out, Level 1, Cindy bday)
google_maps_query: Francette, 1 Port de Suffren, 75007 Paris

name: La Felicità
short_description: Massive Italian food court in a converted train station — something for everyone.
more_notes: Huge space with multiple Italian food counters — pizza, pasta, gelato, cocktails. Very family-friendly with lots of room for kids. Located in the Station F area (13th arrondissement).
address_or_search_text: La Felicità, 5 Parvis Alan Turing, Paris
google_maps_query: La Felicità, 5 Parvis Alan Turing, 75013 Paris

name: Rue Cler
short_description: Charming pedestrian market street near the Eiffel Tower — perfect for food shopping and snacking.
more_notes: A wonderful walking street lined with bakeries, cheese shops, chocolate shops, and cafés. Great for picking up picnic supplies before heading to the Champ de Mars. Very close to the Eiffel Tower.
google_maps_query: Rue Cler, 75007 Paris

name: Aura Invalides
short_description: Immersive light and sound show projected inside the Dôme des Invalides — magical at night.
more_notes: A stunning immersive light show inside the dome of Les Invalides. Check current schedules and book tickets in advance. A great evening activity for all ages.
address_or_search_text: Aura Invalides, Hôtel des Invalides, Paris
google_maps_query: Aura Invalides, 2 Place Vauban, 75007 Paris

name: Mon Premier Cabaret at Paradis Latin
short_description: Family-friendly cabaret show designed for kids — sparkle, acrobatics, and French flair.
more_notes: A cabaret show specifically designed to be appropriate and engaging for children. The Paradis Latin venue is a beautiful Gustave Eiffel-designed theater. Book tickets in advance.
address_or_search_text: Paradis Latin, 28 Rue du Cardinal Lemoine, Paris
google_maps_query: Paradis Latin, 28 Rue du Cardinal Lemoine, 75005 Paris

name: Grand Café des Capucines
short_description: Grand brasserie near the Opéra with fresh oysters, classic French fare, and a kids' menu.
more_notes: A large, family-friendly brasserie with a kids' menu — helpful for picky eaters. Known for oysters and traditional French brasserie dishes. Beautiful interior.
address_or_search_text: Grand Café des Capucines, 4 Boulevard des Capucines, Paris
source_notes: Spreadsheet (restaurant w/ oysters & kids menu) — name normalized from 'Grand Cage des Capucines'
google_maps_query: Grand Café Capucines, 4 Bd des Capucines, 75009 Paris

name: Musée des Arts Forains
short_description: Magical private museum of vintage fairground arts — carousels, games, and spectacles you can ride.
more_notes: A hidden gem in the Bercy neighborhood. Open Wednesdays and weekends only — check current hours and book in advance, as visits are usually guided tours. Kids absolutely love it because you can actually ride the antique carousels and play the old fairground games. Located in the beautiful Pavillons de Bercy.
address_or_search_text: Musée des Arts Forains, 53 Avenue des Terrasses, Paris 12th
google_maps_query: Musée des Arts Forains, 53 Av. des Terroirs de France, 75012 Paris
